article_metadata.description: The Congressional Budget Office made several miscalculations of the Affordable Care Act's impact, including overestimating total exchange enrollment, overestimating enrollment of higher income people who do not qualify for subsidies, projecting too many healthy enrollees relative to less healthy enrollees, and underestimating premium increases. CBO’s next estimate will likely show a lower budgetary cost principally because ACA plans are much less desirable than was expected. Moreover, a lack of young and healthy people buying ACA plans sets the stage for an adverse selection spiral of higher average premiums and diminished enrollment of everyone but people with expensive health conditions.
article_metadata.author: The Apothecary

Moreover, a lack of young and healthy people buying ACA plans sets the stage for an adverse selection spiral of higher average premiums and diminished enrollment of everyone but people with expensive health conditions.
og.title: A Downgraded Obamacare Baseline
